generalInfo: The 14-day tour unfolds the mysteries of Iran. In this two-week journey, you step into a different world of Iran’s must-sees. It includes modern Tehran, peaceful Kashan, glamorous Isfahan, noble Yazd, and elegant Shiraz, besides the indigenous atmosphere of Kerman deserts. From Tehran to Kerman, you’ll face different authentic cultures, try various Persian foods, and have exciting interactions with locals of different backgrounds. It is a concise lifetime adventure in 14 days.

dayInfo.description: Tehran --- Highlights: Airport pick-up | Tabiat Bridge: Tehran’s largest pedestrian overpass with modern architecture | Bame Tehran: A recreational place and a full view of the city at Tehran heights | Sa’adAbad Palace: A complex of palaces at Tehran's foothills that used to be the summer residence of two Iranian dynasties | Welcoming Dinner: Have you ever tasted Persian dishes?

Tehran --- Highlights: Golestan Palace: UNESCO World Heritage; in the center of Tehran from the 18th century | Tehran Bazaar: The old maze-like market in the heart of Tehran. This 10-kilometer path is the best place to visit people closely | National Museum of Iran: History MomentLargest Museum in Iran with many treasures of Iran's historical and ancient monuments | Treasury of National Jewels: One of the world’s famous collections of jewels and diamonds from Iranian dynasties

Kashan & Abyaneh --- Highlights: Borujerdi House: A vast mansion with full details of Iran’s traditional architecture which was once for a wealthy merchant | Tepe Sialk: History MomentAn ancient site and one of the world’s oldest civilizations that dates back to 6000 BC | Abyaneh Village: A different stop at a historic red village; it is 2500 years old

Isfahan --- Highlights: Naqsh-e Jahan Square: UNESCO World Heritage; the Iranian architecture landmark | Sheikh Lotfollah Mosque: An architectural masterpiece of Iranian mosque architecture and tilework from the Safavid Empire in the 17th century | Shah Mosque: UNESCO World Heritage; an elegant iconic dome piercing the sky | Ali Qapu Palace: The official residence of Safavid Emperors with historically valuable paintings and mosaic work | Chehel Sotoun Palace: UNESCO World Heritage; A pleasant and freshening Persian Garden | House Dinner: A different supper; a Persian-style meal in an Iranian home, together with an Iranian family

Isfahan --- Highlights: Vank Cathedral: A splendid old church in Jolfa, Isfahan’s Armenian neighborhood | Jameh Mosque of Isfahan: UNESCO World Heritage; one of the oldest preserved mosques in Iran | Grand Bazaar of Isfahan: The elegant market of precious Persian carpets and else. What do you think about buying souvenirs? | Khaju Bridge and Si-o-se-pol Bridge: A walking tour over the Zayanderud River at a spirited hangout with songs and music

Yazd --- Highlights: Drive to Yazd | Chak Chak: A sacred Zoroastrian shrine in the mountain | Tower of silence: A different burial space; the Zoroastrians used to leave the corpses there for the carrion birds | Fire Temple & Museum of Zoroastrians: This temple holds a sacred fire that has been lit for more than 1500 years

Yazd --- Highlights: Jame Mosque: The great congregational site from 800 years ago with priceless picturesque architecture | Fahadan Neighborhood: The aroma of thatch within ginger adobe walls is the most memorable thing in this 1000-year-old neighborhood | Amir Chakhmaq Square: A ritual center known for its symmetrical arched cloves | Water Museum: A display of the Iranian genius freshwater system in the desert | Saheb Al Zaman Zurkhaneh: A traditional gym for Iranian martial arts | Dowlatabad Garden: UNESCO World Heritage; a lively Persian Garden in a desert city!

Abarkuh & Pasargadae --- Highlights: The Cypress of Abarkuh: The 3rd oldest tree in the world. It is 4500 years old that literally symbolizes life and hope | Abarkuh Ice House: An ancient adobe structure to store ice in the old times | Pasargadae: UNESCO World Heritage; The majestic capital of ancient Persia’s Achaemenid Great Empire dates back to 559–530 BC

Persepolis & Shiraz --- Highlights: Persepolis: UNESCO World Heritage; A ceremonial complex of ancient Persian kings, The earliest remains of Persepolis are from 515 BC | Necropolis: Ancient Iranian rock reliefs cut into the cliff, from both the Achaemenid and Sassanid periods | Tomb of Hafez: The famous poet of love and mystics rests here

Shiraz --- Highlights: Pink Mosque: The Nasir al-Mulk Mosque with its Orsi-stained glasses creates a colorful spiritual feeling of awe | Vakil Complex: 3 Shiraz popular highlights; Bazaar, Mosque, and bath | Arg of Karim Khan: A castle for the king, Karim Khan, built in the 11th century | Eram Garden: UNESCO World Heritage; A Persian garden with a palace as its sparkling jewel | Shah Cheragh Shrine: A holy tomb that was erected first in the 12th century | Maharloo Lake: A pink lagoon just beside Shiraz

Meymand Rocky Village --- Highlights: Drive to Meymand Village | Walking tour of Meymand and Cave Houses: UNESCO World Heritage; a primary human residence in Iran Plateau. It is man-carved houses in the stone hills from 12000 years ago | An Evening with Villagers: A unique semi-nomad community popular for their way of living in temporary seasonal settlements

Kerman --- Drive to Kerman | Fath Abad Garden: A dignified garden with a magnificent view at night | Jame Mosque of Kerman: Marvelous tilework, paintings, and arcs from the 14th century | Ganjali Khan Complex: A welfare complex from the 17th century, including a bathhouse, school, caravanserai, mosque, and bazaar

Lut Desert --- Highlights: Shazde Mahan Garden: UNESCO World Heritage; a lush Persian Garden and luxury mansion | Shahdad Village: An ancient village in Lut Desert with a unique culture, customs, and local food
Tehran --- Highlights: Off-roading, Adventure in the Lut Desert: UNESCO World Heritage; let yourself go in the wonders of the desert | Flight from Kerman to Tehran | Airport Drop Off
